702463f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side between President and Union Streets. This is a view of 90 Eighth Avenue, formerly the home of C. T. Christensen, and later of Timothy Lester Woodruff, Park Commissioner of Brooklyn and thre times Lieutenant Governor of New York State. 1928.

User contributed content: Note the For Sale sign in front of this house. This picture was taken in 1928. The house was torn down and replaced by an eleven story luxury apartment building of the same address (90 Eighth Avenue) currently named The President, designed by Sugarman and Berger, who also designed The New Yorker Hotel, One Fifth Avenue, and many other bldgs, The President opened in 1929. It is currently a co-op in the original Park Slope Historic District. (gintell@msn.com)
